content.description: This route is the left of two splitters on the east face of the wall. Awesome steep hands to a small roof, head right to join the top of the route Jedi corner to finish. The upper part of the crack looks wide, but protects well with smaller gear. This is a great line on a cool tower-like formation- Get on it!
content.location: It is a little difficult getting to the start of this route because a very loose, and steep gully must be crossed. We crossed high up, then worked our way down to the start. Rappel using anchor atop the route face up to it (climber's R).

content.description: Great face climbing. The first 2/3 is 5.10 climbing with a few ~10+/11- moves. The crux is in the crack right below the last bolt -- awesome cross over move into a solid lay back. Great quality rock and climb.
content.protection: This route is bolted all of the way up the face (7 or 8 bolts). Then, option to place a 0.5 and 00 (or nut) to protect the run out from the last bolt to the chain anchor.
content.location: This route is two routes to the right of "More Desire than Fire" on the face. Note that the approach to this route is pretty heinous through the gully. There is a fairly new bolt to protect the belay. Cross the gully very carefully. Everything is really lose.
